text: yes it's Anja today I'm sharing with you
a delicious beef recipe which is an
Asian fusion dish called seven flavor
beef now if you've ever been to Seattle
and visited a restaurant called al
ginger they made the most amazing seven
flavor beef I've ever tasted and it's
super delicious
well this is my spin on their version of
southern flavor beef that you can make
at home
and the great thing about this is that
once you get the marinade started it's
super quick and easy after that so with
that let's get started
for this recipe we'll need about half a
pound of beef flank steak or skirt steak
and I've gone ahead and use skirt steak
here which I've sliced into thin pieces
against the grain we'll also need one
tablespoon of minced lemongrass and if
you've never used lemongrass before this
is what a stock of the lemongrass looks
like to prepare the lemongrass just
remove the leaves of the outer stock
revealing a younger stem underneath turn
off the very end then slice the stem
into thin slices you can then go ahead
and mince those slices for one
tablespoon of lemongrass
next go ahead and add one tablespoon of
honey half a teaspoon of grated ginger
1/2 a teaspoon of minced garlic 1/2 a
teaspoon of fish sauce half a teaspoon
of dried chili flakes - given a little
bit of spice and one teaspoon of
five-spice powder along with one
teaspoon of sesame oil and one teaspoon
of kosher salt
finally add 3 tablespoons of vegetable
oil which will help mix all those
amazing flavors into our beef when
you're done set this in the fridge and
let it marinate for at least one hour or
if you want extra flavor
you can go ahead and let it marinate
overnight while that's marinating let's
prep the other ingredients for the
stir-fry we'll need a handful or a
quarter cup of green onions sliced
lengthwise a handful of red onions and
20 or so fresh Thai basil leaves plus
some for plating we'll also need one and
a half cups of bean sprouts 2
tablespoons of Voisin sauce and finally
1 tablespoon of pine nuts to give the
dish a nice nutty flavor when you're
ready to cook preheat a pan on medium
heat and stir fry the veggies for one
minute be careful not to overcook
because we still want them to be crunchy
when you're done transfer them to a
serving plate
then we heat your pan down add a bit of
oil and sear your beef over high heat
searing will help bring out the flavors
and after a minute add your voice and
sauce and stir-fried to mix after that
add your Thai basil leaves plus your
pine nuts and continue stir frying for
another minute or so until the beef is
cooked I like my beef cooked medium but
feel free to cook it more or less to
your liking finally plate the beef over
the veggies we cooked earlier and serve
with a small stem of basil leaves to
give the dish and extra pop of color so
this is how you make my version of seven
flavor beat since this is meant to be
served family-style
I recommend serving this with white rice
and something simple like a baby bok
choy I hope you guys try this recipe
because it tastes amazing and if you
guys ever find yourself in Seattle do
stop by well ginger because they have an
amazing seven flavor beat as well so
with that thank you guys so much for
cooking with me today and watching this
video give me a thumbs up if you liked
this video and over
subscribe to my channel enjoy Mama's
kitchen and I will see you guys next
time bye
